title: (x) "Patisserie" shadowed font - Horndon {Mike F}
content:
I think this is a font, it looks familiar. Can anyone ID for me?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140529083901im_/http:/typophile.com/files/patisserie_5254.jpg)
author: vector

comments.content: Ah thank you. I kept thinking Herndon, but couldn't find it anywhere.
When I first saw this thread, I did a search for the keyword "shadow" on MyFonts and Horndon did not come up... Now I see that this face has no keywords assigned to it on MyFonts -- strange.

Thanks for the info, Ricardo. I suggested some of the keywords (to the MyFonts-team). Which anyone, which is interested, can do, btw.

Just fill in the form at _MyFonts Keywords: none [suggest]_.

You're welcome, Rainer. :-)

You know, I saw that link and tried to add some keywords, but something went wrong when I entered my username and password, and I wasn't able to move forward. But thanks for the tip!

And hold on a second! I just went back to MyFonts and found two versions of Horndon.

The [**Elsner+Flake version**](http://web.archive.org/web/20140529083901/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/horndon/) has a couple of keywords... It's the [**Linotype version**](http://web.archive.org/web/20140529083901/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/horndon/) that has none.
